subject: Re: Radio Interview Yesterday on Ghostly Talk...
author: psi_research
full_text:
Hey Guy, thanks for helping to preserve this important chapter in ITC 
history. I'm of the opinion that this early research can help to 
inspire new developments. -Bill
  
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> 
wrote:
>
> There seems to be a problem wiht other techs getting my circuits to 
work as 
> well, although they are getting closer. I think it takes a 
tech/engineer 
> first with an interest in the paranormal to be be even interested 
in 
> building the circuits, then it seems to take a certain amount of 
intuition 
> to get thsi stuff to work. Then, there's a ever present problem of 
the 
> researcher actually being able to hear any contacts.
> 
> Frank
> 
> 
> >From: "Guy" <yzzzguy@...>
> >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: [EVP-ITC] Radio Interview Yesterday on Ghostly Talk...
> >Date: Mon, 04 Jun 2007 19:48:35 -0000
> >
> >Sorry, all...really late notice by me here. I was interviewed by
> >Scott and Doug for about an hour yesterday on Ghostly Talk (
> >http://www.ghostlytalk.com ). The topic? New research I've done on
> >the infamous "Spiricom Mark IV".
> >
> >If you're familiar with the story - basically I believe I've helped
> >dispel the goofy thought that Dr. George JEFFRIES Mueller did NOT
> >work for NASA (people have confused him with Dr. George EDWIN
> >Mueller who DID work for NASA and is considered the "father of
> >Skylab", etc.). Plus I was able to disseminate 2 previously unknown
> >audio recordings (by Dr. David Rivers and the late author Harold
> >Sherman) which showed inconsistencies in the Spiricom recordings 
and
> >how O'Neil "could" have used an artificial larynx to fake the
> >conversations. On the other hand - I tracked down a lot of
> >documentation which definitely shows that Dr. George J. Mueller was
> >a real person and nearly everything written about him (in the
> >Spiricom manual, "The Ghost of 29 Megacycles") is verifiable so...
> >
> >The big questions are:
> >
> >1. If this was a hoax - how DID Bill O'Neil get so much detailed
> >information on Mueller (he actually claimed that Mueller told him
> >all this via clairaudience)? Was he really an extremely good 
psychic?
> >
> >2. If the Spiricom Mark IV really DID work, why were other users
> >(such as Sarah Estep from the AAEVP) unable to get it operate?
> >
> >I still have more things to look into so maybe some more answers
> >will be forthcoming (or muddy the waters even more). And I want to
> >thank member Jaime (i.e. xtal32768@...) for finding the
> >Cornell Alumni News with photo of Mueller at Picatinny Arsenal.
> >
> >Guy
> >
>

on MSN
